column4: Yet another win-to-ubuntu transition question :)  On windows I can open any file by just typing its name in the terminal, or, alternatively, typing "start filename".  Is there an equivalent in Ubuntu?  I would like to avoid having to figure out the exact name of the program that can open a specific file ...
try something like "Gnome-Do" or "Google Desktop", they come up with shortkeys and you can type "part" of files in and find them instantly
not really, you can only start executables by typing their names.  But gnome-open works fine :)
